message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
public class TraceSimulation {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("tracefile.txt"));
            String strLine;
            while ((strLine = br.readLine()) != null) {
                StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(strLine, " ");
                while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                    int accessType = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
                    String memoryAddress = st.nextToken();
                    // Process the accessType and memoryAddress here
                    // Instead of storing them in a list, process them immediately
                }
            }
            br.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your current approach is that you're trying to load all the data into memory at once, which is causing your program to run out of heap space. Instead of storing all the data in an ArrayList, you should process each line of the file immediately as you read it. This way, you're only storing a small amount of data in memory at any given time. The StringTokenizer.nextToken method is used to split each line into the access type and memory address, which can then be processed immediately.
